channel.title: iPod Linux!
channel.description:
Okay, I just felt like I would post this.
iPod Linux is pretty self explanitory, It's Linux on your iPod
This currently only works on 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th Gen. iPods.
I just installed it on my 1GB iPod Nano and it came with some great features:
-MP3 Playback -Voice Recording ( if iPod permits ) -Sweet colour games such as: * Bluecube * Invaders * iPobble * Lights * Nimesweeper * Othello * Pong * Steroids * Tic-Tac-Toe * Tunnel * Tuxchess -File browsing ( For movies/images ) -Appearance/Interchangeable Themes.
How to (basically) install: - Connect your (SUPPORTED) iPod to your computer, in disk mode. - Download and run [url=http://ipodlinux.org/Installer_2]http://ipodlinux.org/Installer_2[/url] ( When the iPod is connected safely ) - Please make sure you download the correct installer for your operating system. - Run the installer and if everything goes correctly it should now be installed. - Disconnect and restart your iPod ( Hold the middle button and MENU button together ) - Boot in either Apple OS ( Normal iPod/iTunes interface ) - or boot in iPod Linux , Which is the new interface which unlocks your iPods full potential.
- You might want to go to settings straight away because the standard click-wheel speed is pretty outrageous.
- When you go to connect your iPod to put music or other media on, re-boot your iPod and start in " DISK MODE " from the main screen.
:)
Post comments / feedback[br][size=1]Posted at: July 19, 2006, 03:46:03 PM[/size][hr]Shit, Wrong forum , Can you please move this ?

item.title: iPod Linux!
item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

I’ve had that on my iPod for about a week, however, I can’t really play around with it because my iPod’s harddrive is seriously fucked. But it’s pretty cool. I had another iPod thing called Rockbox on my iPod before. www.rockbox.org << Pretty cool. I’d say Rockbox is better for looks and iPod Linux is good for like… smart stuff.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Spike wrote:

It will work for video iPods,

And it doesnt use a desktop and a mouse. It is just a way to unlock the full potential of your ipod.

It is basically a normal iPod , with the backbone of linux… unlocks file formats and alot more… ( you can also install DOOM ) See below:

item.title: iPod Linux!
item.dc:creator: @Spike Spike
item.description:
@Spike wrote:

Okay, I just felt like I would post this.

iPod Linux is pretty self explanitory, It’s Linux on your iPod

This currently only works on 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th Gen. iPods.

I just installed it on my 1GB iPod Nano and it came with some great features:

-MP3 Playback
-Voice Recording ( if iPod permits )
-Sweet colour games such as:
* Bluecube
* Invaders
* iPobble
* Lights
* Nimesweeper
* Othello
* Pong
* Steroids
* Tic-Tac-Toe
* Tunnel
* Tuxchess
-File browsing ( For movies/images )
-Appearance/Interchangeable Themes.

How to (basically) install:

  • Connect your (SUPPORTED) iPod to your computer, in disk mode.

  • Download and run http://ipodlinux.org/Installer_2 ( When the iPod is connected safely )

  • Please make sure you download the correct installer for your operating system.

  • Run the installer and if everything goes correctly it should now be installed.

  • Disconnect and restart your iPod ( Hold the middle button and MENU button together )

  • Boot in either Apple OS ( Normal iPod/iTunes interface )

  • or boot in iPod Linux , Which is the new interface which unlocks your iPods full potential.

  • You might want to go to settings straight away because the standard click-wheel speed is pretty outrageous.

  • When you go to connect your iPod to put music or other media on, re-boot your iPod and start in " DISK MODE " from the main screen.
